discourse_list.title: COUNCIL OF PARIS: Cat Herders Ring
Council of Paris 2019: DAO ring notes

content.content: Hey all, here are the notes from the DAO ring. If you attended, please help clarify the sections where I have included the note “[Need to clarify]”    HackMD    Ethereum Magicians - DAO Ring - HackMD # Ethereum Magicians - DAO Ring #### Council of Paris: March 4th, 2019  ## Notes #### We started off       This was the chalkboard with the discussion topics people were proposing at the start of the session:  OKBap7I.jpg1280×960 218 KB  Takeaways DAOs seem to be something we can talk about for months on end. If we want to keep this as an active ring, we should probably focus on one aspect of the system so it can be a valuable use of time and we can create useful documents. The dgov foundation has regular meetings now, and many of the governance-like topics may be best for those meetings. They also have a wiki: https://wiki.dgov.foundation/ As a DAO ring, we can help contribute to dgov’s wiki for our focus area. Action Item What are your thoughts on the topics that are best suited for Magicians (look at the notes for examples, or suggest your own)?

Thanks for posting the notes and photo! One thing that you should think about doing is to create a Discourse discussion for each of the topics described on the board. Some may not get enough attention, but it focuses the conversation. @tjayrush did this for the Data Ring discussions from EthDenver and it was helpful. I like the idea of coordinating with DGOV on this, perhaps work out a protocol for where things are discussed, how the repos are used, and where the final content goes (e.g. the DGOV wiki).

I have added some details to the Token Ring event during the Council of Paris with some suggested topics. It is focused on using tokens to represent securities. There will also be a DeFi track at the conference with lots of related material and presentations (including myself). Please add any topics you’d like to see discussed and your interest to the HackMD document at: https://hackmd.io/DaJhrasLQteUk3IwX5bQAg#7-Token-Ring Thanks, Adam
content.GPT-summary: The author, Adam, has added details to the Token Ring event during the Council of Paris and is asking for feedback on suggested topics. He explains that the event is focused on using tokens to represent securities and there will be a DeFi track at the conference with related material and presentations. Adam invites readers to add topics they would like to see discussed and their interest to the HackMD document.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Hi Adam, The link seems to be protected. Can you please have a look to the permissions ? Thanks ! J.

Yep - this seems to be the case. It is being discussed at:     HackMD document is now protected? Fellowship Gatherings       The previous link:  https://hackmd.io/DaJhrasLQteUk3IwX5bQAg  gives me a 403 error.  Anyone know what’s up with this?  Thanks,  Adam
